etymology.description: 山(山) (shān, "hill") + 石(石) (shí, "rock") = combined elements representing a rocky hill or cliff -> 岩(巖) (yán, "rock; cliff")
etymology.interpretation: The character 岩(巖) (yán, "rock; cliff") combines 山(山) (shān, "hill") and 石(石) (shí, "rock") to convey the image of a rocky hill or a cliff. The original form 巖 emphasized the phonetic 嚴(嚴) (yán), but later 岩 became the more common form.
etymology.simplification: The character 岩(巖) was originally 巖 in traditional script, simplified by dropping the 嚴 component and directly combining 山 and 石 to retain both the sound and meaning efficiently.

examples.chinese: 那块岩静静矗立在河边(那塊岩靜靜矗立在河邊)。
examples.pinyin: Nà kuài yán jìng jìng chùlì zài hé biān.
examples.english: That rock stands quietly by the river bank.

examples.chinese: 登上岩顶(登上岩頂)，看尽山川风光(看盡山川風光)。
examples.pinyin: Dēng shàng yán dǐng, kàn jìn shān chuān fēng guāng.
examples.english: Climb to the top of the rock and behold the scenic mountains and rivers.

examples.chinese: 海浪拍打着悬岩(海浪拍打著懸岩)，发出低沉的轰鸣(發出低沉的轟鳴)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎi làng pāidǎ zhe xuán yán, fāchū dīchén de hōngmíng.
examples.english: The waves crash against the cliff, producing a deep, rumbling sound.
